alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 2:02AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and poor-drainage flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water especially in urban areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 157 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This has likely caused flooding of urban and other poorly-drained areas. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen with localized amounts of 2.5 to 3.0 inches since rain began yesterday afternoon. - Rainfall is coming to an end early this morning. It will likely take a few hours for ponding and other high water to diminish with the potential for lingering impacts around dawn. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Kittery, Bath and Alfred.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
